definition: unexpectedly/actually/to go so far as to/indeed
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
child/son
non-syllabic diminutive suffix/retroflex final
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
unexpectedly/to one's surprise/in spite of everything/in that crazy way/actually/to go as far as to
to go to the bottom of a matter/after all/when all is said and done/(in an interrogative sentence) finally/outcome/result
to have the impertinence/to have the cheek to
unfinished/incomplete
a really determined person will find a solution (idiom); where there's a will, there's a way
pinyin: you3 zhi4 zhe3 shi4 jing4 cheng2

definition: (literary) all day long
persevere and you will succeed (idiom); where there's a will, there's a way
unfulfilled ambition
to check out/to investigate
Jingling, former name of Tianmen 天門|天门, Hubei

sentences.english: It actually took all my luck to meet you for just a moment in my lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 在有生旳瞬间遇见你，竟花光全部运气。

sentences.english: He was in such a hurry to get out that he barged into a passer-by.
sentences.chinese: 他急急忙忙地往外走，竟与一位行人撞了个满怀。

sentences.english: Father and son unexpectedly found that jiang yuan birth mothers tomb was destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 父子二人发现蒋元生母的墓碑竟遭人破坏。

sentences.english: Former call he now have defiled my only self-esteem.
sentences.chinese: 昔日称兄道弟的他现在竟玷污了我唯一的自尊。

sentences.english: Unexpectedly hope that the small lotus is to envy Fu.
sentences.chinese: 竟希望小莲花当个妒妇。

sentences.english: Some go even further to beat the heat, rolling up their pants legs.
sentences.chinese: 有些人为了祛暑甚至过而无不及，竟卷起裤腿来。

sentences.english: Was he so conceited as not to believe in the wisdom of the masses ?
sentences.chinese: 他回如此高傲，竟不相信群众的智慧？

sentences.english: Yet did not the chief butler remember Joseph, but forgat him.
sentences.chinese: 酒政却不记念约瑟，竟忘了他。
守门员竟完全没机会挡球。

sentences.english: That weaves its spell on even a stone heart?
sentences.chinese: 竟把咒语织进铁石心肠？

sentences.english: He was so busy clocking her that he spilt a glass of beer over the table-cloth.
sentences.chinese: 他只顾目不转睛地盯着她，竟把一杯啤酒洒在桌布上。

sentences.english: He requited my kindness with cruel words.
sentences.chinese: 他竟以咒骂来回报我的善待。

sentences.english: Shall evil be recompensed for good? for they have digged a pit for my soul.
sentences.chinese: 岂可以恶报善呢？他们竟挖坑要害我的性命。

sentences.english: I wonder that he didn't hurt himself jumping over that wall.
sentences.chinese: 我纳闷他怎么从那墙上跳过去竟没摔伤自己。

sentences.english: No one knows why, but the fell from grace with the boss.
sentences.chinese: 谁也不知为什么，他竟失宠于上司。

sentences.english: I smile through tears, is the Mona Lisa smile gave me endless strength.
sentences.chinese: 我竟破涕为笑，是蒙娜丽莎的微笑给了我无穷的力量。

really/as expected/sure enough/if indeed.../if it's really...
